title: 89/3/EEC: Commission Decision of 15 December 1988 on health protection measures in connection with imports of certain fresh meat from Brazil
header:
COMMISSION  DECISION
of 15 December 1988
on health protection measures in connection with imports of certain fresh meat from Brazil
(89/3/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The authorization to import fresh meat from Brazil laid down in Decision 86/195/EEC is hereby suspended in respect of fresh meat of bovine animals from the following States:
- Bahia
- Espírito Santo
- Goiás
- Minas Gerais
- Paraná
- Rio de Janeiro
- Santa Catarina
- São Paulo
Member States shall not authorize the importation of fresh meat which has been obtained from bovine carcases which have been deboned in cutting plants in the States listed in Article 1.

Member States shall require the accompanying animal health certificate to be amended so that all references to the States listed in Article 1 are deleted before signature by the official veterinarian in respect of fresh meat obtained from bovine animals.
This Decision shall apply from 1 March 1989.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 15 December 1988.
For the Commission
Frans ANDRIESSEN
Vice-President
